channel.title: Glinek
channel.copyright: © 2024 Szymon Glinka | This website does NOT use any cookies for tracking.

item.title: Chloe - HackYeah2024
item.description: This is a project made in 24h during HackYeah2024 aka. Hackathon. Unfortunately She didn’t win but I’m sure that with a little bit of tweaking and better preparation next time, there is a huge chance to win.

item.title: Pelican Case workstation
item.description: This is a 15kg pelican case that houses lab bench power supply, ethernet switch, second screen, charger for my laptop and much more. Also It’s incredible durable thanks to using a gun hard case.

item.title: RC car mode
item.description: A mod for RC. Completely new remote based on LoRa, new and stronger battery, better H-Bridge. All of those improvements make it more pleasurable to drive. And don’t worry, with a little persistence It should be possible to mod any RC like that.

item.title: Obsium mk2
item.description: Obsium mk2 is an upgraded version of my beloved Obsium. New version comes with Raspberry Pi 5, 512GB SSD and much more. But those upgrades came at a cost of some functionalities of the previous version.

item.title: Otsi cyberpet - mk1
item.description: Otsi is a winning design of a cyberpet made for Cyberdeck Cafe’s contest. Main objective of this contest was to build your personal companion that would need to be taken care of and would serve a real life purpose like helping you with everyday tasks.

item.title: Atrovel calculator
item.description: Atrovel calculator is a project that originated from one of my schools lessons. We were learning how to use 4x4 button matrix and bored Simon decided that it would be a great idea to make a simple calculator.

item.title: Obsium mk1
item.description: Cyberdecks serve a different purpose for everybody. Some create it purely for fun others try to make a perfect „laptop” like device to fulfil all of their needs. For me it is both.

item.title: One-key keyboard
item.description: This is yet another project made for a contest hosted by Cyberdeck Cafe. The objective was to create a keyboard that, as the name suggests, has only one button. Everything else was up to you.

item.title: About Me
item.description:
Hi, I’m Simon
#

I’m an 18yo robotics engineering student. In school I mainly program PLCs (we have siemens s7-1200s) and industrial robots (in labs there are two kuka’s KR 4 R600, one kuka KR16 and three ABB collaborative robots). At home I love programming Arduinos/ESPs/RaspberryPis, 3D printing (my current 3d printer is Ender-3 S1 Pro). In general just making stuff. Besides projects for myself I am designing PCBs for my classmate and making smaller projects for friends and fixing stuff for my family.

item.title: ANUlab
item.description:
What is ANUlab?
#

Anulab is an organization of mine. For now I use it only as a place to post projects (I just prefere when my projects are made under some brand, It just looks more professional). Also, It’s perfect place for my friends and me to work on projects together.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Due to my overuse of computer and phone, even though it is important for what I do. There are two ways to contact me, either via Discord @glinek_tronic or via email simon@glinek.tech
